[[Anardil of Númenor]]}}: South}}</ref> aged 275 years) was the sixth [[King of Gondor]], ruling for 87 years, from {{TA

{{disambig-two: Anardil's reign over [[Gondor]] was uneventful. He is remembered as the last of [[Gondor
the [[Kings of Gondor: Gondor's]] kings to dwell exclusively in the capital of [[Osgiliath]]. Anardil's son, Ostoher, was to set the precedent of the kings spending the summer at [[Minas Anor]], the citadel later known as [[Minas Tirith]].<ref>{{App

{{disambig-two: In ''[[The Peoples of Middle-earth]]'', Section VII "[[The Heirs of Elendil]]", it was explained that three manuscripts existed in the textual history of this section.  Manuscript A contained the Southern Line of Gondor, and appeared to be the first stage of composition.  Manuscript B added the Northern Line, and began as a fair copy of A for the Southern line but became heavily emended.  Manuscript B led to Manuscript C, a fine copy (but with later emendations), which led to a final typescript D.
